citation.article-title: Physiological ecology of Methanobrevibacter cuticularis sp. nov. and Mehanobrevibacter curvatus sp. nov., isolated from the hindgut of the termite Reticulitermes flavipes.

p.s: Description of Methanobrevibacter curvatus sp. nov.
Methanobrevibacter curvatus (cur.va'tus. L. curva, bent; L. adj. curvatus, referring to the curved shape of the cell)
Curved rods with slightly tapered ends, 0.34 by 1.6 μm in size, occurring singly or in pairs.
Gram positive-like by staining and cell wall ultrastructure.
Cells have polar fibers of 3 by 300 nm.
Metabolizes H2 plus CO2, yielding CH4 as the sole product.

Methanol, methanol plus H2, CO, acetate, ethanol, isopropanol, trimethylamine, dimethylamine, theobromine, theophylline, trimethoxybenzoate, lactate, pyruvate, glucose, and formate are not metabolized.
pH optimum, 7.1 to 7.2 (range, 6.5 to 8.5); temperature optimum, 30°C (range, 10 to 30°C).
Complex nutritional supplements, e.g., 40% (vol/vol) clarified rumen fluid and nutrient broth (Difco), required for growth.
Source: Hindgut contents of the termite Reticulitermes flavipes (Kollar) (Rhinotermitidae).
Deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, Germany (DSM 11111).
